variant.question: In addition to ailerons, spoilers might be used at the same time to assist in lateral control. When doing so, how will the spoilers behave?

options.text: Down-going wing spoilers rise proportionally to aileron input, disturbing the airflow over the wing, reducing lift, and creating a roll moment.
Down-going wing spoilers fully rise with aileron input, disturbing the airflow over the wing, reducing lift, and creating a roll moment.
Up-going wing spoilers rise proportionally to aileron input, locally increasing drag, assisting to counteracting adverse yaw.
Up-going wing spoilers fully rise with aileron input, increasing total drag, reducing lift, and creating a roll moment.

variant.question: Where spoilers are used to assist ailerons with lateral control, when rolling to the right, the left aileron moves down and the right aileron moves up. How do the spoilers move?

options.text: The left spoilers remain flush and the right spoilers move up.
The right spoilers and the left spoilers remain flush.
The left spoilers move up and the right spoilers remain flush.
The right spoilers and the left spoilers move up.
